com.threatmetrix.TrustDefender

Class TrustDefender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.threatmetrix.TrustDefender.TrustDefender

  • public class TrustDefender
extends Object
    The TrustDefender object controls everything to do with the TrustDefender SDK A minimal example use might look like this: 
         TrustDefender sdk = TrustDefender.getInstance();

     sdk.init(new Config().setOrgId("my_orgId").setContext(getApplicationContext());
     sdk.doProfileRequest(new EndNotifier(){ public void complete(final ProfilingResult result) {} });
    See the user guide for more information.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TrustDefender getInstance()

      • init

        public THMStatusCode init(Context context,
                 String orgId)
        This must be called once at start up, and performs the various one time initialisations that can be slow.

        Note that this call returns immediately, but the initialisation process will continue in the back ground. Any doProfile() call that is made before initialisation is complete, will wait until completion before proceeding

        Equivalent to the following: 

             init(new Config().setContext(context).setOrgId(orgId));
        Parameters:
        context - The application Context
        orgId - The OrgId received from the ThreatMetrix team.
        Returns:
        A status indicating if the background thread was correctly fired off. Please see THMStatusCode for the complete list of return values.
        See Also:
        TrustDefenderStandardV4.init(Config)

      • init

        public THMStatusCode init(Config config)
        This must be called once at start up, and performs the various one time initialisations that can be slow. Note that this call returns immediately, but the initialisation process will continue in the back ground. Any doProfile() call that is made before initialisation is complete, will wait until completion before proceeding
        Parameters:
        config - An instance of Config class which provide advanced control of TrustDefender behaviour.
        Returns:
        A status indicating if the background thread was correctly fired off. Please see THMStatusCode for the complete list of return values.
        See Also:
        Config, THMStatusCode

      • doProfileRequest

        public THMStatusCode doProfileRequest(EndNotifier endNotifier)
        Initiates a profiling request using the default fingerprint server and options.

        The call will return immediately, and, providing it returns THM_OK, will have started a background thread that performs the processing. Once this background thread completes, the completion notifier will be called, and profiling status can be checked at that point.

        Equivalent to the following: 

             doProfileRequest(new ProfilingOptions().setEndNotifier(endNotifier));
        Parameters:
        endNotifier - an instance of a class which implements EndNotifier and is called when the profiling request is completed
        Returns:
        A status code indicating if the background thread was correctly fired off. This does NOT indicate if the profiling succeeds. Please see THMStatusCode for the complete list of return values.
        See Also:
        TrustDefenderStandardV4.doProfileRequest(ProfilingOptions)

      • doProfileRequest

        public THMStatusCode doProfileRequest(String sessionID,
                             EndNotifier endNotifier)
        Initiates a profiling request using the options supplied. The call will return immediately, and, providing it returns THM_OK, will have started a background thread that performs the processing. Once this background thread completes, the completion notifier will be called, and profiling status can be checked at that point. Note that the completion notifier will be called from a background thread. Care must be taken if you need to do UI updates.

        Equivalent to the following: 

             doProfileRequest(new ProfilingOptions().setSessionID("my sessionid").setEndNotifier(endNotifier));
        Parameters:
        sessionID - unique session id for this profile request
        endNotifier - an instance of a class which implements EndNotifier and is called when the profiling request is completed
        Returns:
        A status code indicating if the background thread was correctly fired off. This does NOT indicate if the profiling succeeds. Please see THMStatusCode for the complete list of return values.
        See Also:
        TrustDefenderStandardV4.doProfileRequest(ProfilingOptions)

      • doProfileRequest

        public THMStatusCode doProfileRequest(ProfilingOptions options)
        Initiates a profiling request using the options supplied. The call will return immediately, and, providing it returns THM_OK, will have started a background thread that performs the processing. Once this background thread completes, the completion notifier will be called, and profiling status can be checked at that point. Note that the completion notifier will be called from a background thread. Care must be taken if you need to do UI updates.
        Parameters:
        options - extra profiling data / options
        Returns:
        A status code indicating if the background thread was correctly fired off. This does NOT indicate if the profiling succeeds. Please see THMStatusCode for the complete list of return values.
        See Also:
        ProfilingOptions

      • getResult

        public ProfilingResult getResult()
        Gets the outcome of the most recent profiling request
        Returns:
        a status

      • doPackageScan

        public boolean doPackageScan(int timeout)
        Starts a scan of all packages. This call launches a background thread and returns immediately. It can only succeed once init() has completed, and will be interrupted if doProfile() is called.
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximum number of milliseconds to spend scanning or 0 to disable the timeout. If this value is too small, it may limit the number of packages visible to the SDK
        Returns:
        true on success, false if init is yet to be called, or if init is still in progress

      • pauseLocationServices

        public void pauseLocationServices(boolean pause)
        Temporarily disable/enable location services. Useful for disabling while in the background.
        Parameters:
        pause - Indicates if we should pause or continue location services

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancel any in progress async profiling request. If called while no request is active, just returns
